text: <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> Antagonizes CREB Transcriptional Activation by Disrupting Coactivator Recruitment

Stimulation of CREB - dependent transcription by reagents that activate adenylate cyclase and increase cAMP levels ( e.g . , forskolin ) increase the transactivation potential of CREB through phosphorylation of serine 133 by protein kinase A , which permits binding and recruitment of coactivators <extra_id_0> CBP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p300 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to the promoter [ 37 , 38 ] .

text: Phosphorylation of serine 133 does not , however , affect the DNA - binding activity of CREB in most cases [ 39-41 ] .
Addition of forskolin to HEK 293T cells stimulated activation of a CREB reporter vector about 65 fold ( Figure 7A ) .
Overexpression of <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was capable of down-regulating forskolin - induced CREB transcriptional activation .

The functional interaction between <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and CREB did not affect the DNA - binding activity of <extra_id_0> CREB-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , but did show a modest decrease in <extra_id_0> activating transcription factor 2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> ATF-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) DNA - binding activity in the presence of forskolin as determined by transcription factor ELISA ( Figure 7B ) .

text: While <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has been shown to bind to and repress activation of both NF-kappaB and NF - AT , exactly how <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> functions to bring about this affect has not been elucidated .

To determine how <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> blocks CREB - dependent transcription , we examined whether <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was capable of ( 1 ) disrupting the recruitment of coactivator proteins and / or ( 2 ) preventing phosphorylation of CREB at serine 133 ( which is a prerequisite for coactivator recruitment ) .
Since both of these events are required for CREB - dependent gene expression , we hypothesized that <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may affect CREB activation at both steps .

To determine whether <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> can disrupt the function / recruitment of the coactivator protein <extra_id_0> p300 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , we introduced a <extra_id_0> Gal4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> reporter vector and a <extra_id_0> Gal4-BD-CREB-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression vector into HEK 293T cells in the absence or presence of <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> p300 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and / or control expression vectors ( Figure 7C ) .

text: We next analyzed the effect of <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on phosphorylation of CREB at serine 133 in forskolin-treated HEK 293T cells by Western blot analysis .

Overexpression of <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> failed to reduce the detectable levels of CREB phosphorylation using a phosphospecific antibody for <extra_id_0> CREB-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( unpublished data ) .

However , when we attempted to determine whether <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> could physically interact with the coactivator protein <extra_id_0> p300 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , we found that <extra_id_0> p300 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> immunoprecipitated <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> when both proteins were overexpressed in HEK 293T cells ( Figure 7D ) .

text: Collectively , these results suggest that <extra_id_0> Foxp3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antagonizes CREB - dependent gene expression by directly interacting with coactivator <extra_id_0> p300 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and interfering with its function and / or recruitment to CREB - responsive promoter sequences .
